title: Font ID for something close to this Art Deco lettering sample
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804034028im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ScandalSandals_6712.jpg)

Hello,

This sample is from an old ad, and is almost certainly hand-lettered. I know there are typefaces out there with a similar look, I just can't find any right now. I'm specifically interested in something with that "lazy" leaning S, and the low crossbar on the A. Any suggestions are welcome, thanks in advance.
author: Cranialtorque

comments.content: Maybe Mark's beautiful [Mostra Nuova](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804034028/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/marksimonson/mostra-nuova/) could work for you?

another option is [Estilo](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804034028/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/estilo/estilo/)'s lowercase, which isn't really lowercase and has the "lazy" S. the A is right-leaning as well in the standard glyph set, but it [looks like](http://web.archive.org/web/20140804034028/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/estilo/estilo/characters.html) there's an alternative upright one; no low crossbar, though.
Thanks! They both seem close enough to do the trick.
